task.summary: Default task

Starting to implement a very explicit UserEditorComp, which will contain the update logic explicitly and we will be able to follow and control - in the browser - on the page - how the update, cache invalidation and reloading will take place, step by step.
Later this logic will be generalized and moved "somewhere elsewhere", where exactly, I don't know yet. Possibly into some helper function, residing somewhere in the Cache's companion object - or some conceptually closely related place.
-------------------------------------------------- Tuesday, 24 September 2019 19.00.45:
Writing a TODO list - that specifies the above outlined functionality precisely.

-------------------------------------------------- Tuesday, 24 September 2019 19.00.45:
Writing a TODO list - that specifies the above outlined functionality precisely. -------------------------------------------------- Tuesday, 24 September 2019 20.38.12:
Re-thinking, re-factoring the read-cache's implementation / design. More specifically, adding "stale" state "handling", or at least the possibility of it, in terms of Option[Either[..,..]]
--------------------------------------------------

Starting to implement a very explicit UserEditorComp, which will contain the update logic explicitly and we will be able to follow and control - in the browser - on the page - how the update, cache invalidation and reloading will take place, step by step.
Later this logic will be generalized and moved "somewhere elsewhere", where exactly, I don't know yet. Possibly into some helper function, residing somewhere in the Cache's companion object - or some conceptually closely related place.
-------------------------------------------------- Tuesday, 24 September 2019 19.00.45:
Writing a TODO list - that specifies the above outlined functionality precisely. -------------------------------------------------- Tuesday, 24 September 2019 20.38.12:
Re-thinking, re-factoring the read-cache's implementation / design. More specifically, adding "stale" state "handling", or at least the possibility of it, in terms of Option[Either[..,..]]
-------------------------------------------------- Tuesday, 24 September 2019 21.38.49:
Code compiles.
Added "Stale" functionality to Cache, and rewrite the "toOption casting" such that it gives `Some` even for stale states.

Starting to implement a very explicit UserEditorComp, which will contain the update logic explicitly and we will be able to follow and control - in the browser - on the page - how the update, cache invalidation and reloading will take place, step by step.
Later this logic will be generalized and moved "somewhere elsewhere", where exactly, I don't know yet. Possibly into some helper function, residing somewhere in the Cache's companion object - or some conceptually closely related place.

-------------------------------------------------- Tuesday, 24 September 2019 21.38.49:
Code compiles.
Added "Stale" functionality to Cache, and rewrite the "toOption casting" such that it gives `Some` even for stale states. -------------------------------------------------- Tuesday, 24 September 2019 21.59.51:
Added some documentation and a few more Cache Entry States.
